winter.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the season after autumn and before spring, when the weather is coldest
winter.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Fuel supplies could be seriously disrupted this winter.
It usually snows here in the winter.
winter.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: In a hard winter, many birds starve.
The long winter finally came to an end.
During the winter months the town is often cut off.
I need a new winter coat.
Even in the depths of winter, the harbour is never completely frozen.
She dreaded the onset of winter.
winter.translation[0].note_box[1].items[: in winter/in the winter
You use in winter or in the winter when saying that something happens at that time
It often snows here in winter
We’re going skiing in the winter
last winter/this winter etc
Don’t use in with these words
last winter/this winter etc
You say last winter
Last winter the temperature fell to minus 20 degrees
In last winter the temperature fell to minus 20 degrees
last winter/this winter etc
You say this winter
We’ve had a lot of snow this winter
We’ve had a lot of snow in this winter
last winter/this winter etc
You say next winter
Next winter she will turn 18
In next winter she will turn 18
last winter/this winter etc
You say  that winter
The lake froze over that winter
The lake froze over in that winter
winter.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Last year, over 11,000 Canadians wintered in Arizona.
